title: Add a loading screen example

labels.name: D-Trivial
labels.description: Nice and easy! A great choice to get started with Bevy

labels.name: C-Examples
labels.description: An addition or correction to our examples

labels.name: A-Assets
labels.description: Load files from disk to use for things like images, models, and sounds

body:
## What problem does this solve or what need does it fill?

Loading and unloading assets on a per-level basis is a simple and generally effective strategy. Commonly, this process is masked from users, using loading screens.

We should teach users how to do this in Bevy.

## What solution would you like?

Requirements:

- use a simple state to track asset loading state: `Loading` vs `FullyLoaded`
- spawn some assets in a scene
- show a loading screen to users before assets are loaded
- swap to that scene once (but not before) all assets are loaded

Stretch goals:

- animate the loading screen
- show progress on the loading screen
- transition between multiple levels (may require #11426 to do nicely), unloading assets from the old level as you do so
- wait for shader pipelines to compile too

## What alternative(s) have you considered?

A more dynamic asset loading solution can work better for e.g. open world games, but is more complex to implement and optimize.

We could also implement a first-party solution for this, but I suspect that the complexity will not be high enough to warrant it and the added flexibility / transparency of doing this as an example will be better.

## Additional context

[bevy_asset_loader](https://github.com/NiklasEi/bevy_asset_loader) is a more sophisticated tool for this. You can see a simple implementation of this pattern [in my archived game Emergence](https://github.com/Leafwing-Studios/Emergence/blob/1dc8ab5050739f8047f24c7a3f60ab091cd46888/emergence_lib/src/asset_management/mod.rs#L53). [iyes_progress](https://github.com/IyesGames/iyes_progress) demonstrates how to track progress and transition states when work is complete.
